transportAdvice: Detroit is a car-centric city where public transit coverage is limited, though a light rail line runs along the main downtown corridor and buses serve broader areas; renting a car is strongly recommended for exploring beyond the city center. Taxis and ride-hail vehicles are available downtown, but walking between attractions is only practical within specific neighborhoods.

weather.description: Cold and often snowy with grey skies; pack heavy winter layers and expect icy conditions.
Still bitterly cold with frequent snow and wind; one of the harshest months for outdoor activity.
Temperatures begin to rise but remain chilly with a mix of rain and late-season snow possible.
Spring arrives with mild days and cool nights; rain is common but outdoor exploration becomes pleasant.
Comfortable and increasingly warm with blooming greenery; a great time to visit before summer heat sets in.
Warm and humid with long daylight hours; outdoor festivals and events begin in earnest.
The hottest month with high humidity; expect lively street life but plan for heat during midday.
Still hot and humid with occasional thunderstorms; peak summer activity and events continue.
Temperatures ease into a pleasant early autumn; one of the most enjoyable months to visit Detroit.
Crisp fall weather with colorful foliage; cooler evenings require a jacket but days remain comfortable.
Cold and increasingly grey with rain and early snow possible; outdoor time becomes limited.
Cold and wintry with snow likely; holiday events and indoor cultural attractions make it worthwhile despite the chill.
